CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, March 4, 1961, pg. 10 reads: "Negro History Series Begins - The class on Negro history, which is being sponsored by Wesley Center AME Zion Church, as a service to the Greater Pittsburgh community, got off to a good beginning recently with nearly 100 registrants. Mrs. Marion Jordon, standing, left, is chief instructor for the class series, which will continue each Monday evening, from 7 to 8 o'clock, in lower church vestry, through March 27.  Others may still register by calling the church office, MA. I-9612.  The Rev. Charles H. Foggie, who initiated the idea, is pastor of the church. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Marion Bond Jordon facing group, including Rev. Charles Foggie on right, seated in wooden folding chairs in Wesley Center AME Zion church for Negro History Series class
